newsitem.title: FRANCE: France says drought worries remain despite rain.
newsitem.headline: France says drought worries remain despite rain.

text.p: France's environment ministry said on Thursday that it will maintain water restrictions taken to cope with low supplies, as the drought situation remained "worrying" despite recent rains.

"Rain since end-April brought welcome relief, particularly to farming. However, even if rainfall was above normal for the first ten days of May, this does not change the worrying aspect of the situation analysed during the meeting of the drought committee on April 29," the ministry said in a statement.
"It is thus justified to maintain precautionary measures already taken in many departments and under consideration in others," it added.
The number of French departments affected by water restrictions since early April has now reached 27.

Environment minister Corinne Lepage has also asked regional authorities to reactivate, when necessary, water management programmes designed to deal with tight supplies and to set up stricter control of large water users.
The ministry said it will provide a new update on the water supply situation on June 11.
Recent rains have however eased concerns over France's grain crop though this month's rainfall will be crucial, national grain office ONIC officials have said.
